us.ba3.me.markers

Class MarkerInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ba3.me.markers.MarkerInfo

  • public final class MarkerInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes information about a marker. The engine will create and provide an instance of this object to a marker map's MarkerMapDelegate for each marker that needs to be displayed for non-dynamic marker map layers.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      PointF anchorPoint
      Point that represents which pixel on the marker should be placed on the geographic coordinate the marker represents.

      The name of previously cached image to use for the marker.
      PointF hitTestSize
      Dimensions of the hit-test box for the marker in points.
      byte[] imageData
      Buffer of RGBA8888 pixels that represent the image for the marker.
      int imageHeight
      Height of marker image.
      int imageWidth
      Width of marker image.
      boolean isVisible
      Defaults to YES, but may be set to NO by the marker delegate if this marker is not to be drawn.
      Location location
      Geographic location of the marker.
      java.lang.String metaData
      Contains meta data provided when the marker was generated.
      int minimumLevel
      Minimum level the marker should appear.
      boolean nearestNeighborTextureSampling
      When a marker texture is drawn, the default sampling of it's texture is bilinear.
      PointF offset
      Controls how far to offset the marker image in screen space from its computed target location.
      float rotation
      Rotation of the marker in degrees.
      MarkerRotationType rotationType
      Specifies how the engine will render rotation of the marker.
      int uid
      The row id of the marker from the sqlite database.
      float weight
      Weight of the marker.

      void setImage(Bitmap bitmap)

    • Field Detail

      • uid

        public int uid
        The row id of the marker from the sqlite database.

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible
        Defaults to YES, but may be set to NO by the marker delegate if this marker is not to be drawn.

      • metaData

        public java.lang.String metaData
        Contains meta data provided when the marker was generated.

      • weight

        public float weight
        Weight of the marker.

      • rotation

        public float rotation
        Rotation of the marker in degrees.

      • rotationType

        public MarkerRotationType rotationType
        Specifies how the engine will render rotation of the marker. The default is kMarkerRotationScreenEdgeAligned.

      • location

        public Location location
        Geographic location of the marker.

      • cachedImageName

        public java.lang.String cachedImageName
        The name of previously cached image to use for the marker. If uiImage is nil, the property is checked.

      • anchorPoint

        public PointF anchorPoint
        Point that represents which pixel on the marker should be placed on the geographic coordinate the marker represents. You should set this property when the mapping engine makes a request to the marker delegate to update the marker info.

      • offset

        public PointF offset
        Controls how far to offset the marker image in screen space from its computed target location. This for example, would be used if you want the marker to appear beside its location.

      • hitTestSize

        public PointF hitTestSize
        Dimensions of the hit-test box for the marker in points. When set to anything other than width=0, height=0 (the default), this property overrides the normal hitTesting logic for the marker which is based on the anchor point and size of the marker image. This property should only be set when the marker image size is small enough that targeting it with a finger-tap would be difficult due to it being too small. When set, this size is automatically scaled to physical coordinates to take into account retina displays. The hit testing logic considers a box of this size around the anchor point of the marker.

      • minimumLevel

        public int minimumLevel
        Minimum level the marker should appear. Defaults to 0. Set to higher if you want the marker to only appear at higher zoom levels.

      • nearestNeighborTextureSampling

        public boolean nearestNeighborTextureSampling
        When a marker texture is drawn, the default sampling of it's texture is bilinear. For some markers, for example those with text that you wish to be as crisp as possible on-screen, this can appear less readable when a marker image pixel falls between screen pixels. Setting this to YES will force nearest-neighbor sampling of the texture. The down-side, is that when the marker is being animated or panned around the map it's image may appear to 'snap' to pixel alignment.

      • imageData

        public byte[] imageData
        Buffer of RGBA8888 pixels that represent the image for the marker. You can call setImage, or you can place data here. Be sure to set imageWidth and imageHeight as well if you do.

      • imageWidth

        public int imageWidth
        Width of marker image.

      • imageHeight

        public int imageHeight
        Height of marker image.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MarkerInfo

        public MarkerInfo()

    • Method Detail

      • setImage

        public void setImage(Bitmap bitmap)
        You should set the marker image if you are not setting cachedImageName when the mapping engine makes a request to the marker delegate to update the marker info.
